3/*
4 * Intel ACPI functions
5 *
6 * _DSM related code stolen from nouveau_acpi.c.
7 */
8#include <sys/cdefs.h>
9__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_acpi.c,v 1.6 2018/08/27 04:58:24 riastradh Exp $");
10
11#include <linux/pci.h>
12#include <linux/acpi.h>
13#include <drm/drmP.h>
14#include "i915_drv.h"
15
16#ifdef CONFIG_ACPI
17
18#ifdef __NetBSD__
19#include <dev/acpi/acpireg.h>
20#define _COMPONENT ACPI_BUTTON_COMPONENT
21ACPI_MODULE_NAME("acpi_intel_brightness")
22
23static ACPI_OBJECT *
24acpi_evaluate_dsm(ACPI_HANDLE handle, const uint8_t *uuid, int rev, int func,
25 ACPI_OBJECT *argv4)
26{
27 ACPI_OBJECT_LIST arg;
28 ACPI_OBJECT params[4];
29 ACPI_BUFFER buf;
30 ACPI_STATUS rv;
31
32 if (handle == NULL)
33 handle = ACPI_ROOT_OBJECT;
34
35 arg.Count = 4;
36 arg.Pointer = params;
37 params[0].Type = ACPI_TYPE_BUFFER;
38 params[0].Buffer.Length = 16;
39 params[0].Buffer.Pointer = (char *)__UNCONST(uuid);
40 params[1].Type = ACPI_TYPE_INTEGER;
41 params[1].Integer.Value = rev;
42 params[2].Type = ACPI_TYPE_INTEGER;
43 params[2].Integer.Value = func;
44 if (argv4 != NULL) {
45 params[3] = *argv4;
46 } else {
47 params[3].Type = ACPI_TYPE_PACKAGE;
48 params[3].Package.Count = 0;
49 params[3].Package.Elements = NULL;
50 }
51
52 buf.Pointer = NULL;
53 buf.Length = ACPI_ALLOCATE_LOCAL_BUFFER;
54
55 rv = AcpiEvaluateObject(handle, "_DSM", &arg, &buf);
56 if (ACPI_SUCCESS(rv))
57 return (ACPI_OBJECT *)buf.Pointer;
58 return NULL;
59}
60
61static inline ACPI_OBJECT *
62acpi_evaluate_dsm_typed(ACPI_HANDLE handle, const uint8_t *uuid, int rev,
63 int func, ACPI_OBJECT *argv4, ACPI_OBJECT_TYPE type)
64{
65 ACPI_OBJECT *obj;
66
67 obj = acpi_evaluate_dsm(handle, uuid, rev, func, argv4);
68 if (obj != NULL && obj->Type != type) {
69 ACPI_FREE(obj);
70 obj = NULL;
71 }
72 return obj;
73}
74
75#define ACPI_INIT_DSM_ARGV4(cnt, eles) \
76{ \
77 .Package.Type = ACPI_TYPE_PACKAGE, \
78 .Package.Count = (cnt), \
79 .Package.Elements = (eles) \
80}
81
82static bool
83acpi_check_dsm(ACPI_HANDLE handle, const uint8_t *uuid, int rev, uint64_t funcs)
84{
85 ACPI_OBJECT *obj;
86 uint64_t mask = 0;
87 int i;
88
89 if (funcs == 0)
90 return false;
91
92 obj = acpi_evaluate_dsm(handle, uuid, rev, 0, NULL);
93 if (obj == NULL)
94 return false;
95
96 if (obj->Type == ACPI_TYPE_INTEGER)
97 mask = obj->Integer.Value;
98 else if (obj->Type == ACPI_TYPE_BUFFER)
99 for (i = 0; i < obj->Buffer.Length && i < 8; i++)
100 mask |= (uint64_t)obj->Buffer.Pointer[i] << (i * 8);
101 ACPI_FREE(obj);
102
103 if ((mask & 0x1) == 0x1 && (mask & funcs) == funcs)
104 return true;
105 return false;
106}
107#endif
108
109#define INTEL_DSM_REVISION_ID 1 /* For Calpella anyway... */
110#define INTEL_DSM_FN_PLATFORM_MUX_INFO 1 /* No args */
111
112static struct intel_dsm_priv {
113#ifdef __NetBSD__
114 ACPI_HANDLE dhandle;
115#else
116 acpi_handle dhandle;
117#endif
118} intel_dsm_priv;
119
120static const u8 intel_dsm_guid[] = {
121 0xd3, 0x73, 0xd8, 0x7e,
122 0xd0, 0xc2,
123 0x4f, 0x4e,
124 0xa8, 0x54,
125 0x0f, 0x13, 0x17, 0xb0, 0x1c, 0x2c
126};
127
128static const char *intel_dsm_port_name(u8 id)
129{
130 switch (id) {
131 case 0:
132 return "Reserved";
133 case 1:
134 return "Analog VGA";
135 case 2:
136 return "LVDS";
137 case 3:
138 return "Reserved";
139 case 4:
140 return "HDMI/DVI_B";
141 case 5:
142 return "HDMI/DVI_C";
143 case 6:
144 return "HDMI/DVI_D";
145 case 7:
146 return "DisplayPort_A";
147 case 8:
148 return "DisplayPort_B";
149 case 9:
150 return "DisplayPort_C";
151 case 0xa:
152 return "DisplayPort_D";
153 case 0xb:
154 case 0xc:
155 case 0xd:
156 return "Reserved";
157 case 0xe:
158 return "WiDi";
159 default:
160 return "bad type";
161 }
162}
163
164static const char *intel_dsm_mux_type(u8 type)
165{
166 switch (type) {
167 case 0:
168 return "unknown";
169 case 1:
170 return "No MUX, iGPU only";
171 case 2:
172 return "No MUX, dGPU only";
173 case 3:
174 return "MUXed between iGPU and dGPU";
175 default:
176 return "bad type";
177 }
178}
179
180static void intel_dsm_platform_mux_info(void)
181{
182 int i;
183#ifdef __NetBSD__
184 ACPI_OBJECT *pkg, *connector_count;
185#else
186 union acpi_object *pkg, *connector_count;
187#endif
188
189 pkg = acpi_evaluate_dsm_typed(intel_dsm_priv.dhandle, intel_dsm_guid,
190 INTEL_DSM_REVISION_ID, INTEL_DSM_FN_PLATFORM_MUX_INFO,
191 NULL, ACPI_TYPE_PACKAGE);
192 if (!pkg) {
193 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("failed to evaluate _DSM\n");
194 return;
195 }
196
197#ifdef __NetBSD__
198 connector_count = &pkg->Package.Elements[0];
199 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("MUX info connectors: %lld\n",
200 (unsigned long long)connector_count->Integer.Value);
201 for (i = 1; i < pkg->Package.Count; i++) {
202 ACPI_OBJECT *obj = &pkg->Package.Elements[i];
203 ACPI_OBJECT *connector_id = &obj->Package.Elements[0];
204 ACPI_OBJECT *info = &obj->Package.Elements[1];
205 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Connector id: 0x%016llx\n",
206 (unsigned long long)connector_id->Integer.Value);
207 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" port id: %s\n",
208 intel_dsm_port_name(info->Buffer.Pointer[0]));
209 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" display mux info: %s\n",
210 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->Buffer.Pointer[1]));
211 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" aux/dc mux info: %s\n",
212 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->Buffer.Pointer[2]));
213 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" hpd mux info: %s\n",
214 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->Buffer.Pointer[3]));
215 }
216#else
217 connector_count = &pkg->package.elements[0];
218 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("MUX info connectors: %lld\n",
219 (unsigned long long)connector_count->integer.value);
220 for (i = 1; i < pkg->package.count; i++) {
221 union acpi_object *obj = &pkg->package.elements[i];
222 union acpi_object *connector_id = &obj->package.elements[0];
223 union acpi_object *info = &obj->package.elements[1];
224 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Connector id: 0x%016llx\n",
225 (unsigned long long)connector_id->integer.value);
226 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" port id: %s\n",
227 intel_dsm_port_name(info->buffer.pointer[0]));
228 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" display mux info: %s\n",
229 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->buffer.pointer[1]));
230 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" aux/dc mux info: %s\n",
231 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->buffer.pointer[2]));
232 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER(" hpd mux info: %s\n",
233 intel_dsm_mux_type(info->buffer.pointer[3]));
234 }
235#endif
236 ACPI_FREE(pkg);
237}
238
239#ifdef __NetBSD__
240static bool intel_dsm_pci_probe(ACPI_HANDLE dhandle)
241#else
242static bool intel_dsm_pci_probe(struct pci_dev *pdev)
243#endif
244{
245#ifndef __NetBSD__
246 acpi_handle dhandle;
247
248 dhandle = ACPI_HANDLE(&pdev->dev);
249#endif
250 if (!dhandle)
251 return false;
252
253 if (!acpi_check_dsm(dhandle, intel_dsm_guid, INTEL_DSM_REVISION_ID,
254 1 << INTEL_DSM_FN_PLATFORM_MUX_INFO)) {
255 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no _DSM method for intel device\n");
256 return false;
257 }
258
259 intel_dsm_priv.dhandle = dhandle;
260 intel_dsm_platform_mux_info();
261
262 return true;
263}
264
265#ifdef __NetBSD__
266
267static int vga_count;
268static bool has_dsm;
269
270/* XXX from sys/dev/pci/vga_pcivar.h */
271#define DEVICE_IS_VGA_PCI(class, id) \
272 (((PCI_CLASS(class) == PCI_CLASS_DISPLAY && \
273 PCI_SUBCLASS(class) == PCI_SUBCLASS_DISPLAY_VGA) || \
274 (PCI_CLASS(class) == PCI_CLASS_PREHISTORIC && \
275 PCI_SUBCLASS(class) == PCI_SUBCLASS_PREHISTORIC_VGA)) ? 1 : 0)
276
277static int
278intel_dsm_vga_match(const struct pci_attach_args *pa)
279{
280
281 if (!DEVICE_IS_VGA_PCI(pa->pa_class, pa->pa_id))
282 return 0;
283
284 vga_count++;
285 struct acpi_devnode *node = acpi_pcidev_find(0 /*XXX segment*/,
286 pa->pa_bus, pa->pa_device, pa->pa_function);
287 if (node != NULL)
288 has_dsm |= intel_dsm_pci_probe(node->ad_handle);
289 return 0;
290}
291
292static bool intel_dsm_detect(struct drm_device *dev)
293{
294 char acpi_method_name[255] = { 0 };
295
296 vga_count = 0;
297 has_dsm = false;
298 pci_find_device(&dev->pdev->pd_pa, intel_dsm_vga_match);
299
300 if (vga_count == 2 && has_dsm) {
301 const char *name = acpi_name(intel_dsm_priv.dhandle);
302 strlcpy(acpi_method_name, name, sizeof(acpi_method_name));
303 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("VGA switcheroo: detected DSM switching method %s handle\n",
304 acpi_method_name);
305 return true;
306 }
307
308 return false;
309}
310#else
311static bool intel_dsm_detect(void)
312{
313 char acpi_method_name[255] = { 0 };
314 struct acpi_buffer buffer = {sizeof(acpi_method_name), acpi_method_name};
315 struct pci_dev *pdev = NULL;
316 bool has_dsm = false;
317 int vga_count = 0;
318
319 while ((pdev = pci_get_class(PCI_CLASS_DISPLAY_VGA << 8, pdev)) != NULL) {
320 vga_count++;
321 has_dsm |= intel_dsm_pci_probe(pdev);
322 }
323
324 if (vga_count == 2 && has_dsm) {
325 acpi_get_name(intel_dsm_priv.dhandle, ACPI_FULL_PATHNAME, &buffer);
326 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("vga_switcheroo: detected DSM switching method %s handle\n",
327 acpi_method_name);
328 return true;
329 }
330
331 return false;
332}
333#endif
334
335#ifdef __NetBSD__
336void intel_register_dsm_handler(struct drm_device *dev)
337{
338 if (!intel_dsm_detect(dev))
339 return;
340}
341#else
342void intel_register_dsm_handler(void)
343{
344 if (!intel_dsm_detect())
345 return;
346}
347#endif
348
349void intel_unregister_dsm_handler(void)
350{
351}
352
353#endif /* CONFIG_ACPI */
